Package com.chess.board

Class Move

java.lang.Object
com.chess.board.Move
Direct Known Subclasses:
Move.CaptureMove, Move.KingSideCastleMove, Move.NonCaptureMove, Move.NullMove, Move.PawnJump, Move.PawnMove, Move.PawnPromotion, Move.QueenSideCastleMove
public abstract class Move
extends java.lang.Object
Move is an abstract class that wherein the methods here will be fleshed out in the subsequent child classes The following methods are found here: hashCode(), equals(), getCurrentPosition(), getMovePosition(), getMovedPiece(), isAttack(), isCastlingMove(), getAttackedPiece(), getBoard(), and execute()

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Move.CaptureMove
    Capture Move is a child class of Move.
    static class  Move.KingSideCastleMove
    KingSideCastleMove is a child class of CastleMove It is for the specific castle move in the kingside which chess players sometimes call short castle The methods found here are: equals() and toString()
    static class  Move.MajorAttackMove
    MajorAttackMove is a child class of Capture Move class This MajorAttackMove is a capture move that is done by Major pieces which are the King, Queen, Knight, Bishop, and the Rook The methods found here are the following: equals() and toString()
    static class  Move.MoveFactory
    Move Factory is a class that uses the Static Factory design pattern because there are cases that we will make a move not knowing the piece we are moving The method createMove() can be found here
    static class  Move.NonCaptureMove
    NonCaptureMove is a child class of move It deals with Moves that just moves a piece from one tile to an unoccupied tile The methods found here are: equals() and toString()
    static class  Move.NullMove
    Null move is a child class of the Move class Null Object Design Pattern is applied to represent a null object rather than to return just a null
    static class  Move.PawnCaptureMove
    PawnCaptureMove is a child class of the CaptureMove It deals with the special capture move of the pawns The methods found here are: equals() and toString()
    static class  Move.PawnEnPassantMove
    PawnEnPassantMove is a child class of the PawnCaptureMove It deals with the special capture move of the pawn when there is an enPassantPawn on the board An enPassant Pawn in chess is when a Pawn jumps 2 tiles forward where there is an enemy pawn in one of its sides The rules in chess allows this pawn to be captured The methods found here are: equals(), execute() and toString()
    static class  Move.PawnJump
    PawnJump is a child class of Move It deals with the special movement of the pawn in which if it is its first move it can jump 2 tiles forward The methods found here are: execute() and toString()
    static class  Move.PawnMove
    PawnCaptureMove is a child class of Move The methods found here are: equals() and toString()
    static class  Move.PawnPromotion
    PawnPromotion class is a child class of Move It follows the decorator design pattern to add functionality to the pawn
    static class  Move.QueenSideCastleMove
    QueenSideCastleMove is a child class of CastleMove It is for the specific castle move in the queenside which chess players sometimes call long castle The methods found here are: equals() and toString()

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
    Override the equals() of java.lang because java.lang equals() tests the reference equality.
    Board execute()
    execute() is a method that executes the move and returns a new board with the changed game state made by the move
    Piece getAttackedPiece()
    getAttackedPiece() is a method that returns null here for the parent class but we will override it for the specific child classes
    Board getBoard()
    getBoard() is a method that returns the board for the caller
    int getCurrentPosition()
    getCurrentPosition() is a method that returns the movedPiece position on the chessboard It does not take any parameter
    Piece getMovedPiece()
    getMovedPiece() is a method that lets the caller get the movedPiece
    int getMovePosition()
    getMovePosition() is a method that returns the resulting position if the move is made
    int hashCode()
    Override the hashCode() of java.lang because the way the code is written keeps in mind immutability of the program the hashCode of the object will not change so we can call it from here.
    boolean isAttack()
    isAttack() is a boolean method that returns false for the Move class because not all moves in a chess game is an attacking or capture move so we can state it to be false always but we will override it for specific child classes of move
    boolean isCastlingMove()
    isCastlingMove() is a boolean method that returns false for the Move class because most moves made is not a castling move so we can state it to be false here but override it for the specific child class later on

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Override the hashCode() of java.lang because the way the code is written keeps in mind immutability of the program the hashCode of the object will not change so we can call it from here.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      result which is an integer containing the hashcode

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
      Override the equals() of java.lang because java.lang equals() tests the reference equality. We don't want that but rather we want object equality so we override it to fit our need
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      other - an object to be compared with
      Returns:
      a boolean to see if the objects are equal

    • getCurrentPosition

      public int getCurrentPosition()
      getCurrentPosition() is a method that returns the movedPiece position on the chessboard It does not take any parameter
      Returns:
      the position of the movedPiece which is an integer value

    • getMovePosition

      public int getMovePosition()
      getMovePosition() is a method that returns the resulting position if the move is made
      Returns:
      the movePosition which is an integer value

    • getMovedPiece

      public Piece getMovedPiece()
      getMovedPiece() is a method that lets the caller get the movedPiece
      Returns:
      the movedPiece which is a piece object

    • isAttack

      public boolean isAttack()
      isAttack() is a boolean method that returns false for the Move class because not all moves in a chess game is an attacking or capture move so we can state it to be false always but we will override it for specific child classes of move
      Returns:
      boolean which is false

    • isCastlingMove

      public boolean isCastlingMove()
      isCastlingMove() is a boolean method that returns false for the Move class because most moves made is not a castling move so we can state it to be false here but override it for the specific child class later on
      Returns:
      a boolean which is false

    • getAttackedPiece

      public Piece getAttackedPiece()
      getAttackedPiece() is a method that returns null here for the parent class but we will override it for the specific child classes
      Returns:
      null always for the Move class

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      getBoard() is a method that returns the board for the caller
      Returns:
      this.board which is a board object

    • execute

      public Board execute()
      execute() is a method that executes the move and returns a new board with the changed game state made by the move
      Returns:
      a Board Object that is built by the builder class
